title: 8.3 Mn litres of alcohol consumption cut after tax hike: ADIC
byline: The Alcohol and Drug Information Centre (ADIC) revealed that a 20% excise tax increase on alcohol last year led to a staggering reduction of 8.3 million litres in alcohol consumption while boosting government revenue by Rs. 11.6 billion.

title: Four new Supreme Court justices sworn-in
byline: Four newly appointed Supreme Court Justices took their oaths of office before President Anura Kumara Disanayake this morning (12) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Upcountry train service disrupted due to landslide
byline: Train services have been disrupted due to a landslide between Ohia and Idalgasinna railway stations, caused by the current weather conditions.

title: Former Minister Indradasa Hettiarachchi passes away
byline: Former Minister and Kalutara Distrcrct MP Indradasa Hettiarachchi has passed away at the age of 99.

title: Plans afoot to boost Homeopathy services
byline: Sri Lanka is set to expand homeopathy as part of its healthcare system, focusing on making it more affordable and accessible for the public.

title: Shootings linked to organised crimes claim 66 lives in 2024-2025
byline: A troubling rise in shootings linked to organised crime has left 66 people dead in over 100 incidents reported across the country since January 2024. Of these, 13 deaths occurred in organised crime-related shootings involving the underworld in the last three months alone.

title: Schoolgirl kidnapped in Daulagala
byline: Authorities have launched an investigation into the abduction of a schoolgirl in the Daulagala Police Division, an incident that has gained significant attention on social media.

title: Catholic Church demands a fresh probe on All saints Church ’’bomb drama’’
byline: The Catholic Church of Sri Lanka today urged the government to carryout a fresh probe on the ’’bomb drama’’ at All Saints Church Borella which took place exactly three years ago and bring the perpetrators to book.

title: Elephant closes Tempitiya-Mahaoya road for three days
byline: The Tempitiya-Mahaoya road in Ampara has been closed for traffic and pedestrian movement for the past three days due to an injured wild elephant frequenting the road.

title: Prison Department permits visits on Thai Pongal day
byline: The Prisons Department announced that visitors will be allowed to see inmates on Thai Pongal day (January 14), Prisons Commissioner and media spokesman Gamini B. Dissanayake said.

title: Another flood threat in rice producing North Central Province
byline: Hot on the heels of heavy rains and floods destroying a large swathe of paddy fields in North Central Province last month several tanks and reservoirs in the Anuradhapura District had reached spill over level by yesterday morning due to the heavy rain experienced in the catchment areas.

title: Four miles on Nallathanniya-Maskeliya road crammed with vehicles
byline: A heavy influx of pilgrims and foreign tourists was experienced in Sri Pada sacred area during the long weekend from last Saturday (11).

title: Vehicles damaged in buffalo collision on Southern Expressway
byline: A car, a bus and a lorry were damaged after colliding with three buffaloes this morning on the Southern Expressway between Agunukolapelessa and Barawakumbuka, the Agunukolapelessa Police said.

title: South Korea air crash recorders missing final four minutes
byline: Flight data and cockpit voice recorders from the South Korean passenger plane that crashed last month stopped recording four minutes before the disaster, the country’s transport ministry has said.

title: Upcountry train services resume
byline: The disrupted train service between Ohiya and Idalgashinna railway stations has resumed, and train services are operating as usual, the Railways Department said.
